News & Events    Partnerships    Research    Opportunities    Moore-Sloan    Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment at NYU    Data Science Showcase    Data Science Lunch Seminar Series    Data Science Incubator       Programs & Admissions       MS Programs    Overview    Curriculum    Non-Degree Program    Faculty & Staff    Admissions    Requirements    Careers in Data Science    Apply    Frequently Asked Questions       Current Students       Welcome    Registration Information    Student Resources    Course Grid    Course Pages    Important Dates    Student Profiles    Current Student Questions       Contact Us                                          NYU Center for Data Science                                                                                                                                            DS-GA-1007 Programming for Data Science (Spring 2015)                                                                                                                                                                                                             Course Director: Greg Watson   Teaching assistant: TBD   Lecture time: Tuesday 6:20pm – 8:10pm, 5WP, Room 101   Lab time: Tuesday 8:20pm – 9:10pm, 5WP, Room 101   NYU Classes site   Office Hours   Tuesday 5:00pm – 6:00pm, 7th Floor, 726 Broadway, or by appointment   Course Description   The Programming for Data Science course is aimed at providing students with the skills necessary to use Python for data analysis in scientific computing. In particular the course will cover:     Python 2.7   The NumPy package for scientific computing   The pandas data analysis library, including reading and writing of CSV files   The IPython and PyDev development environments   The Matplotlib 2D plotting library     The course will also provide an introduction to best-practice software engineering techniques and Unix command line tools.   Download a copy of the syllabus .                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Location     The Center for Data Science is located on the Washington Square campus in the heart of Greenwich Village.     726 Broadway, 7th Floor, New York, NY 10003   Email: datascience-group@nyu.edu         Map: View                                                                    CDS Communities       Twitter   ‎  Facebook     LinkedIn                                                                          CDS Science     Blog                                                                                                                                                      About the NYU Center for Data Science   Opportunities   What is Data Science? NYU CDS- Fall 2014 Adjunct Position (DS-GA 1007 Programming for Data Science) - NYU Center for Data Science                                                                                                                          About CDS       Overview    About CDS    What is Data Science?    News & Events    Partnerships    Research    Opportunities    Moore-Sloan    Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment at NYU    Data Science Showcase    Data Science Lunch Seminar Series    Data Science Incubator       Programs & Admissions       MS Programs    Overview    Curriculum    Non-Degree Program    Faculty & Staff    Admissions    Requirements    Careers in Data Science    Apply    Frequently Asked Questions       Current Students       Welcome    Registration Information    Student Resources    Course Grid    Course Pages    Important Dates    Student Profiles    Current Student Questions       Contact Us                                                                 Center for Data Science                                                                                                                   About CDS       Overview    About CDS    What is Data Science?    News & Events    Partnerships    Research    Opportunities    Moore-Sloan    Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment at NYU    Data Science Showcase    Data Science Lunch Seminar Series    Data Science Incubator       Programs & Admissions       MS Programs    Overview    Curriculum    Non-Degree Program    Faculty & Staff    Admissions    Requirements    Careers in Data Science    Apply    Frequently Asked Questions       Current Students       Welcome    Registration Information    Student Resources    Course Grid    Course Pages    Important Dates    Student Profiles    Current Student Questions       Contact Us                                          NYU Center for Data Science                                                                                                                                            NYU CDS- Fall 2014 Adjunct Position (DS-GA 1007 Programming for Data Science)                                                                                                                                                                                                             The NYU Center for Data Science (CDS) is a focal point for New York University’s university-wide initiative in data science and statistics. The Center was established to help advance NYU’s goal of creating the country’s leading data science training and research facilities, and arming researchers and professionals with tools to harness the power of big data.   CDS recently accepted its second cohort of students, who will begin the 2-year Master of Science in Data Science program this September 2014. Admission to the MS in Data Science requires substantial but specific mathematical competencies, typical of a major in mathematics, statistics, engineering, physics, theoretical economics, and computer science with sufficient mathematical training. In addition, applicants to the degree should have some training in programming and basic computer science.   In anticipation of welcoming its second cohort, CDS is seeking an adjunct professor to teach its introductory-level graduate course: DS-GA 1008 Programming for Data Science this fall 2014 semester.  This course will serve as preparation for the higher-level required courses in the program:  http://cds.nyu.edu/ academics/ms-in-data-science/ curriculum/required-courses/ .   The adjunct professor will give 2 back-to-back 50-minute lectures (with a 10-minute break) once per week for 14 weeks.  A lab will also be held once per week for the 14 weeks of the semester, and the professor will be able to help select the lab leader and shape the content of the lab instruction.   The course should cover the following topics:       Python 2.7   Numpy   Software engineering   The Unix command line   The pandas DataFrame structure and library   Reading and writing of CSV files using pandas   IPython command line toolkit   Matplotlib       The adjunct professor should be well-versed in the above-mentioned topics, have teaching experience, and be willing to commit to the course for the full 14-week semester. Degree(s) in computer science, data science, or similar fields are preferred.   Please note that applicants should also be NY-based, or be able to attend all lectures and office hours as needed.  The course will take place at the Washington Square campus of NYU, and the department is unfortunately unable to provide reimbursement for transportation, accommodations, and other living expenses.   Interested applicants should e-mail their resume/CV and cover letters to  ds-jobs-group@nyu.edu .   NYU is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Location     The Center for Data Science is located on the Washington Square campus in the heart of Greenwich Village.     726 Broadway, 7th Floor, New York, NY 10003   Email: datascience-group@nyu.edu         Map: View                                                                    CDS Communities       Twitter   ‎  Facebook     LinkedIn                                                                          CDS Science     Blog                                                                                                                                                      About the NYU Center for Data Science   Opportunities   What is Data Science?
